title: create_roc_curve
text:
create_roc_curve(
    probs,
    reals,
    by=0.01,
    stratified_by=['probability_threshold'],
    size=600,
    color_values=['#1b9e77', '#d95f02', '#7570b3', '#e7298a', '#07004D', '#E6AB02', '#FE5F55', '#54494B', '#006E90', '#BC96E6', '#52050A', '#1F271B', '#BE7C4D', '#63768D', '#08A045', '#320A28', '#82FF9E', '#2176FF', '#D1603D', '#585123'],
)
Create ROC Curve.











Name
Type
Description
Default




probs
Dict[str, np.ndarray]
Dictionary mapping a label or group name to an array of predicted probabilities for the positive class.
required


reals
Union[np.ndarray, Dict[str, np.ndarray]]
Ground-truth binary labels (0/1) as a single array, or a dictionary mapping the same label/group keys used in probs to arrays of ground-truth labels.
required


by
float
Resolution for probability thresholds when computing the curve (step size). Default is 0.01.
0.01


stratified_by
Sequence[str]
Sequence of column names to stratify the performance data by. Default is [“probability_threshold”].
['probability_threshold']


size
int
Plot size in pixels (width and height). Default is 600.
600


color_values
List[str]
List of color hex strings to use for the plotted lines. If not provided, a default palette is used.
['#1b9e77', '#d95f02', '#7570b3', '#e7298a', '#07004D', '#E6AB02', '#FE5F55', '#54494B', '#006E90', '#BC96E6', '#52050A', '#1F271B', '#BE7C4D', '#63768D', '#08A045', '#320A28', '#82FF9E', '#2176FF', '#D1603D', '#585123']









Name
Type
Description





Figure
A Plotly Figure containing the ROC curve(s).






The function delegates computation and plotting to _create_rtichoke_plotly_curve_binary and returns the resulting Plotly figure.

title: prepare_performance_data_times
text:
prepare_performance_data_times(
    probs,
    reals,
    times,
    fixed_time_horizons,
    heuristics_sets=[{'censoring_heuristic': 'adjusted', 'competing_heuristic': 'adjusted_as_negative'}],
    stratified_by=('probability_threshold',),
    by=0.01,
)
Prepare performance data with a time dimension.











Name
Type
Description
Default




probs
Dict[str, np.ndarray]
Mapping from dataset name to predicted probabilities (1-D numpy arrays).
required


reals
Union[np.ndarray, Dict[str, np.ndarray]]
True event labels. Can be a single array aligned to pooled probabilities or a dictionary mapping each dataset name to its true-label array. Labels are expected to be integers (e.g., 0/1 for binary, or competing event codes).
required


times
Union[np.ndarray, Dict[str, np.ndarray]]
Event or censoring times corresponding to reals. Either a single array or a dictionary keyed like probs when multiple datasets are provided.
required


fixed_time_horizons
list[float]
Fixed time horizons (same units as times) at which to evaluate performance.
required


heuristics_sets
list[Dict]
List of heuristic dictionaries controlling censoring/competing-event handling. Default is a single heuristic set: [{"censoring_heuristic": "adjusted",     "competing_heuristic": "adjusted_as_negative"}]
[{'censoring_heuristic': 'adjusted', 'competing_heuristic': 'adjusted_as_negative'}]


stratified_by
Sequence[str]
Stratification variables used to create combinations/breaks. Defaults to ("probability_threshold",).
('probability_threshold',)


by
float
Step width for probability-threshold breaks (used to create the grid of cutoffs). Defaults to 0.01.
0.01














Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
A Polars DataFrame containing performance metrics computed across probability thresholds and fixed time horizons. Columns include the probability cutoff, fixed time horizon, heuristic identifiers, and AJ-derived performance measures.

title: plot_lift_curve
text:
plot_lift_curve(
    performance_data,
    stratified_by=['probability_threshold'],
    size=600,
)
Plot Lift curve from performance data.











Name
Type
Description
Default




performance_data
pl.DataFrame
A Polars DataFrame containing performance metrics for the Lift curve. Expected columns include (but may not be limited to) probability_threshold and lift-related metrics, plus any stratification columns.
required


stratified_by
Sequence[str]
Sequence of column names used for stratification in the performance_data. Default is [“probability_threshold”].
['probability_threshold']


size
int
Plot size in pixels (width and height). Default is 600.
600









Name
Type
Description





Figure
A Plotly Figure containing the Lift plot.






This function wraps _plot_rtichoke_curve_binary to produce a ready-to-render Plotly figure from precomputed performance data.

title: prepare_performance_data
text:
prepare_performance_data(
    probs,
    reals,
    stratified_by=('probability_threshold',),
    by=0.01,
)
Prepare performance data for binary classification.











Name
Type
Description
Default




probs
Dict[str, np.ndarray]
Mapping from dataset name to predicted probabilities (1-D numpy arrays).
required


reals
Union[np.ndarray, Dict[str, np.ndarray]]
True event labels. Can be a single array aligned to pooled probabilities or a dictionary mapping each dataset name to its true-label array. Labels are expected to be binary integers (0/1).
required


stratified_by
Sequence[str]
Stratification variables used to create combinations/breaks. Defaults to ("probability_threshold",).
('probability_threshold',)


by
float
Step width for probability-threshold breaks (used to create the grid of cutoffs). Defaults to 0.01.
0.01














Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
A Polars DataFrame containing performance metrics computed across probability thresholds. Columns include the probability cutoff and performance measures.






>>> import numpy as np
>>> probs_dict_test = {
...     "small_data_set": np.array(
...         [0.9, 0.85, 0.95, 0.88, 0.6, 0.7, 0.51, 0.2, 0.1, 0.33]
...     )
... }
>>> reals_dict_test = [1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1]
>>> prepare_performance_data(
...     probs_dict_test,
...     reals_dict_test,
...     by=0.1
... )

title: plot_decision_curve
text:
plot_decision_curve
plot_decision_curve(
    performance_data,
    decision_type,
    min_p_threshold=0,
    max_p_threshold=1,
    size=None,
    color_values=['#1b9e77', '#d95f02', '#7570b3', '#e7298a', '#07004D', '#E6AB02', '#FE5F55', '#54494B', '#006E90', '#BC96E6', '#52050A', '#1F271B', '#BE7C4D', '#63768D', '#08A045', '#320A28', '#82FF9E', '#2176FF', '#D1603D', '#585123'],
    url_api='http://localhost:4242/',
)
Plot Decision Curve
Args: performance_data (DataFrame): description decision_type (str): description min_p_threshold (int, optional): description. Defaults to 0. max_p_threshold (int, optional): description. Defaults to 1. size (Optional[int], optional): description. Defaults to None. color_values (List[str], optional): description. Defaults to None. url_api (type, optional): description. Defaults to “http://localhost:4242/”.
Returns: Figure: description

title: create_calibration_curve
text:
create_calibration_curve
create_calibration_curve(
    probs,
    reals,
    calibration_type='discrete',
    size=None,
    color_values=None,
    url_api='http://localhost:4242/',
)
Creates Calibration Curve
Args: probs (Dict[str, List[float]]): description reals (Dict[str, List[int]]): description calibration_type (str, optional): description. Defaults to “discrete”. size (Optional[int], optional): description. Defaults to None. color_values (List[str], optional): description. Defaults to None. url_api (type, optional): description. Defaults to “http://localhost:4242/”.
Returns: Figure: description

title: plot_gains_curve
text:
plot_gains_curve(
    performance_data,
    stratified_by=['probability_threshold'],
    size=600,
)
Plot Gains curve from performance data.











Name
Type
Description
Default




performance_data
pl.DataFrame
A Polars DataFrame containing performance metrics for the Gains curve. Expected columns include (but may not be limited to) probability_threshold and gains-related metrics, plus any stratification columns.
required


stratified_by
Sequence[str]
Sequence of column names used for stratification in the performance_data. Default is [“probability_threshold”].
['probability_threshold']


size
int
Plot size in pixels (width and height). Default is 600.
600









Name
Type
Description





Figure
A Plotly Figure containing the Gains plot.






This function wraps _plot_rtichoke_curve_binary to produce a ready-to-render Plotly figure from precomputed performance data.

title: create_decision_curve
text:
create_decision_curve
create_decision_curve(
    probs,
    reals,
    decision_type='conventional',
    min_p_threshold=0,
    max_p_threshold=1,
    by=0.01,
    stratified_by='probability_threshold',
    size=None,
    color_values=['#1b9e77', '#d95f02', '#7570b3', '#e7298a', '#07004D', '#E6AB02', '#FE5F55', '#54494B', '#006E90', '#BC96E6', '#52050A', '#1F271B', '#BE7C4D', '#63768D', '#08A045', '#320A28', '#82FF9E', '#2176FF', '#D1603D', '#585123'],
    url_api='http://localhost:4242/',
)
Create Decision Curve
Args: probs (Dict[str, List[float]]): description reals (Dict[str, List[int]]): description decision_type (str, optional): description. Defaults to “conventional”. min_p_threshold (float, optional): description. Defaults to 0. max_p_threshold (float, optional): description. Defaults to 1. by (float, optional): description. Defaults to 0.01. stratified_by (str, optional): description. Defaults to “probability_threshold”. size (Optional[int], optional): description. Defaults to None. color_values (List[str], optional): description. Defaults to None. url_api (type, optional): description. Defaults to “http://localhost:4242/”.
Returns: Figure: description
